description:
**Fix Overview**:

To address the Windows cryptographic services remote code execution vulnerability (CVE-2024-30020), it's crucial to apply the appropriate updates based on your system configuration.

1. Identify your Windows version and build number.
2. Download and install the relevant update from the update catalog:
   - For Windows 10 (x64): [KB5037788](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5037788)
   - For Windows 10 (32-bit): [KB5037788](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5037788)
   - For Windows 11 (22H2 & 23H2 x64): [KB5037771](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5037771)
   - For Windows 11 (21H2): [KB5037770](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5037770)
   - For Windows 10 Version 22H2: [KB5037768](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5037768)
3. Restart your system after installation to ensure that changes take effect.

**Details**:
- The updates correct improper certificate validation and heap-based buffer overflow vulnerabilities that could lead to remote code execution.
- Ensure that all critical data is backed up before proceeding with the update installation.
